sentences.sContent: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.sCn: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.sContent: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.sCn: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

sentences.sContent: ...a little knowledge concerned with some people called a hardship into an enjoyable stay away from the troubles of modern society...
...creativity and knowledge in a way that a person working independently cannot; but teamwork may also lead to confusion...
...With this comprehensive knowledge of the history of art...
...the less knowledge the child may turn out to have...
...and the lack of knowledge is difficult if not impossible to compen...
...we should be delighted to pursue knowledge for its own sake--even when what we find out is something we didn't particularly want to 36...
...you have to be aware of a gap in your knowledge in the first place...
...we should feel happy when we pursue knowledge for knowledge's sake...
...we cannot learn basic knowledge and ethics that phones are unable to teach us...
...not only do we acquire knowledge but we learn how to communicate with people...

trans.tranOther: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience
